title: SpaceX valuation climbs to $180 billion
summary: The valuation of Elon Musk’s SpaceX hit $180 billion based on an ongoing secondary share sale, CNBC confirmed Wednesday.

title: SpaceX yet to select launch pad for next Axiom Space private astronaut mission
summary: As Axiom Space gears up for its third private astronaut mission to the International Space Station in less than a month, SpaceX is still determining what launch pad it will use for it.

title: FCC upholds denial of Starlink’s $900 million rural broadband subsidies
summary: The Federal Communications Commission is standing by last year’s decision to deny Starlink nearly $900 million in rural broadband subsidies.

title: Daily Telescope: A space-based camera spys a secretive Project Kuiper satellite
summary: Amazon has been reticent to share details about its Kuiper satellites.

title: HyImpulse and Orbex Received £6.7M in UK Space Agency Funding
summary:
The UK Space Agency has awarded £6.7 million in funding to Orbex and HyImpulse to “help cement the UK’s position as Europe’s leading destination for commercial spaceflight activities.” HyImpulse was awarded £3.4 million to undertake its “Hybrid Propulsion Test Programme” which will precede the proposed maiden flight of the company’s SL1 launch vehicle from SaxaVord […]
The post HyImpulse and Orbex Received £6.7M in UK Space Agency Funding appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: House committee debates space mining
summary: A House hearing on space mining turned into a partisan debate about both the viability of the nascent field and the jurisdiction of the committee to examine it.

title: True Anomaly Secures $100M To Expand Space Security Technologies Development
summary: Denver-based startup True Anomaly has successfully raised $100 million in a Series B funding round, marking a significant milestone for the company as it continues its mission to advance space surveillance technology.

title: Air New Zealand To Conduct Starlink Trial In Late 2024
summary: Air New Zealand has announced plans to trial Starlink broadband on domestic flights; positioning itself in the intensifying competition to connect planes using Low Earth Orbit (LEO) services.

title: Voyager Space Announces 2 StarLab Demo Mission With NASA
summary: Voyager Space's StarLab space station has reached two significant milestones as part of its Space Act Agreement with NASA.

title: Can the private sector plug the weather data gap? Space Force to launch new study
summary: The U.S. Space Force will launch a new market research study next year to assess commercial weather services to fill some of the military's ever-growing data needs.
